title: Texans RB Foster tears Achilles
text:
Texans RB Foster tears Achilles Running back to miss remainder of season UPDATED 10:36 AM CDT Oct 26, 2015 Photos Thomas B. Shea/Getty Images 
To add injury to the insult of a 44-26 drubbing at the hands of the Miami Dolphins on Sunday, the Houston Texans learned that running back Arian Foster has a torn Achilles tendon, according to the NFL Network. Panthers' Barkov has broken hand 29min 
Foster left the game with 4:04 left in the fourth quarter, suffering a right Achilles tendon injury even though he was untouched on the play. 
"It obviously didn't look very good," Texans coach Bill O'Brien said. "I feel terrible for him." 
Foster finished the game with 18 carries for 59 yards, and five catches for 66 yards, and two touchdowns. 
Ian Rapoport reported the tear, per a source of the of NFL Network reporter. 
O'Brien didn't have an update on his star running back immediately after the game, but the Texans confirmed he hurt his Achilles tendon and San Diego Chargers team physician David M. Chao said via Twitter the rupture was evident on video replays. 
Foster, who missed time earlier this season with a groin injury, has 63 carries for 164 yards, and 22 receptions for 227 yards this season. He will miss the remainder of the season.
